section.name: Registered as a Windows service
section.p: You can register the Fess as a Windows service in a Windows environment. How to register a service is similar to the Tomcat.

subsection.name: Advance preparation
subsection.p: Because if you registered as a Windows service, the crawling process is going to see Windows system environment variablesIs Java JAVA_HOME environment variables for the system to register, As well as Add %JAVA_HOME%\bin to PathYou must.

subsection.name: Setting
subsection.p: to edit the webapps \fess\WEB-INF\classes\fess.dicon, remove the-server option.

subsection.name: How to register
subsection.p: First, after installing the Fess from the command prompt service.bat performs (such as Vista to launch as administrator you must). Fess was installed on C:\Java\fess-server-9.0.0.
subsection.source: > cd C:\Java\fess-server-9.0.0\bin > service.bat install fess ... The service 'fess' has been installed.

subsection.name: How to check the setting
subsection.p: By making the following you can review properties for Fess. To run the following, Tomcat Properties window appears.

subsection.name: Service settings
subsection.p: Control Panel - to display the management tool in administrative tools - services, you can set automatic start like normal Windows services.

subsection.name: available in 64-bit environment
subsection.p: Distributed in the Fess is 64-bit binaries for Windows Tomcat builds based on. If you use 32-bit WindowsTomcat Of the site from, such as 32-bit Windows zip, please replace tomcat7.exe, tomcat7w.exe, tcnative-1.dll.
